eras.title: World War I
eras.summary: The First World War, a global conflict centered in Europe.

events.title: War Begins
events.notes: Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia.

events.title: First Battle of the Marne
events.notes: Allied counteroffensive halts German advance outside Paris.

events.title: Gallipoli Campaign
events.notes: Allied attempt to open a sea route to Russia fails against Ottoman defenses.

events.title: Battle of Verdun
events.notes: Longest battle of the war grinds down French and German armies.

events.title: United States Enters War
events.notes: U.S. Congress declares war on Germany.

events.title: Bolshevik Revolution
events.notes: Russia withdraws from the war amid domestic upheaval.

events.title: Spring Offensive
events.notes: Germany launches Operation Michael on the Western Front.

events.title: Hundred Days Offensive
events.notes: Allied counteroffensive pushes German forces back.

events.title: Armistice
events.notes: End of World War I.

eras.title: World War II
eras.summary: The Second World War, the most widespread conflict in history.

events.title: Invasion of Poland
events.notes: Germany invades Poland.

events.title: Battle of France
events.notes: Germany launches blitzkrieg in Western Europe.

events.title: Battle of Britain
events.notes: RAF repels Luftwaffe air offensive.

events.title: Operation Barbarossa
events.notes: Germany invades the Soviet Union.

events.title: Pearl Harbor
events.notes: Japan attacks U.S. Pacific Fleet; America enters war.

events.title: Battle of Midway
events.notes: Turning point in the Pacific as U.S. carriers sink four Japanese carriers.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad
events.notes: Soviet counteroffensive encircles and defeats 6th Army.

events.title: Allied Invasion of Sicily
events.notes: Operation Husky opens the campaign in Italy.

events.title: D-Day
events.notes: Allied landings in Normandy.

events.title: Battle of the Bulge
events.notes: Germany's final major offensive in the West.

events.title: V-E Day
events.notes: Germany surrenders in Europe.

events.title: Hiroshima
events.notes: First atomic bomb used in war.

events.title: V-J Day
events.notes: Japan surrenders.

eras.title: Korean War
eras.summary: UN coalition defends South Korea against North Korean and Chinese forces.

events.title: War Begins
events.notes: North Korea invades across the 38th parallel.

events.title: Pusan Perimeter
events.notes: UN forces hold final defensive line in southeast Korea.

events.title: Inchon Landing
events.notes: MacArthur's amphibious assault turns the tide.

events.title: Chinese Intervention
events.notes: Massed PLA forces push UN troops south.

events.title: MacArthur Relieved
events.notes: President Truman replaces MacArthur with Ridgway.

events.title: Armistice Talks Begin
events.notes: Negotiations open at Kaesong then Panmunjom.

events.title: MiG Alley Air Battles
events.notes: UN air forces contest jet combat over northwest Korea.

events.title: Post-Stalin Thaw
events.notes: Leadership change in Moscow accelerates negotiations.

events.title: Armistice Signed
events.notes: Ceasefire establishes the DMZ.

eras.title: Cold War
eras.summary: Geopolitical tension between the Soviet Union and the United States.

events.title: Truman Doctrine
events.notes: U.S. pledges support to nations resisting communism.

events.title: Berlin Blockade
events.notes: Soviet blockade of Berlin.

events.title: NATO Founded
events.notes: North Atlantic Treaty Organization formed.

events.title: Sputnik Launched
events.notes: First artificial satellite intensifies space race.

events.title: Berlin Wall Built
events.notes: East Germany seals the border around West Berlin.

events.title: Cuban Missile Crisis
events.notes: Nuclear standoff.

events.title: Prague Spring Crushed
events.notes: Warsaw Pact troops invade Czechoslovakia.

events.title: SALT I Signed
events.notes: U.S. and USSR agree to strategic arms limits.

events.title: Soviet Invasion of Afghanistan
events.notes: Red Army intervenes to prop up Kabul.

events.title: KAL 007 Shot Down
events.notes: Soviets destroy a Korean Air Lines passenger jet.

events.title: INF Treaty
events.notes: Eliminates intermediate-range missiles in Europe.

events.title: Fall of Berlin Wall
events.notes: Symbolic end of Cold War.

events.title: USSR Dissolves
events.notes: Formal end of the Soviet Union.

eras.title: Vietnam War
eras.summary: Conflict in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia.

events.title: MAAG Takes Command
events.notes: U.S. Military Assistance Advisory Group assumes responsibility in South Vietnam.

events.title: Diem Overthrown
events.notes: South Vietnamese coup removes Ngo Dinh Diem.

events.title: Gulf of Tonkin
events.notes: Incident leads to escalation.

events.title: Rolling Thunder
events.notes: U.S. bombing campaign.

events.title: Marines Arrive at Da Nang
events.notes: First major U.S. ground combat troops deploy.

events.title: Tet Offensive
events.notes: Major North Vietnamese offensive.

events.title: My Lai Massacre
events.notes: U.S. troops kill hundreds of civilians.

events.title: Easter Offensive
events.notes: PAVN conventional push across the DMZ.

events.title: Linebacker I
events.notes: U.S. bombing campaign.

events.title: Linebacker II
events.notes: U.S. bombing campaign.

events.title: Paris Peace Accords
events.notes: Ceasefire agreement.

events.title: U.S. Combat Troops Withdraw
events.notes: Last U.S. ground units leave South Vietnam.

events.title: Fall of Saigon
events.notes: North Vietnamese forces capture the capital.

eras.title: Gulf War
eras.summary: U.S.-led coalition liberates Kuwait after Iraq's invasion.

events.title: Iraq Invades Kuwait
events.notes: Saddam Hussein annexes Kuwait.

events.title: Operation Desert Shield
events.notes: U.S. deploys forces to defend Saudi Arabia.

events.title: UN Resolution 678
events.notes: Security Council authorizes force if Iraq does not withdraw.

events.title: Air Campaign Begins
events.notes: Coalition launches precision strikes across Iraq and Kuwait.

events.title: Ground Offensive
events.notes: Coalition VII Corps punches through Iraqi defenses.

events.title: Highway of Death
events.notes: Retreating Iraqi columns destroyed north of Kuwait City.

events.title: Ceasefire Declared
events.notes: Iraq accepts coalition terms; combat stops.

eras.title: Kosovo War
eras.summary: NATO intervenes against Serbian forces targeting Kosovar Albanians.

events.title: Serbian Crackdown
events.notes: Yugoslav security forces begin large-scale operations in Drenica.

events.title: NATO Activation Order
events.notes: Alliance threatens air strikes unless Belgrade complies with ceasefire.

events.title: Raƒçak Massacre
events.notes: Killing of civilians galvanizes international action.

events.title: Operation Allied Force
events.notes: NATO air campaign begins against Yugoslavia.

events.title: Belgrade Infrastructure Strikes
events.notes: Expanded target list hits regime nodes and media.

events.title: Chinese Embassy Bombing
events.notes: Errant NATO strike inflames diplomacy.

events.title: Military-Technical Agreement
events.notes: Serbian forces withdraw; KFOR deploys.

eras.title: War Against ISIS
eras.summary: Global coalition dismantles the Islamic State's territorial caliphate.

events.title: Mosul Falls
events.notes: ISIS seizes Iraq's second-largest city.

events.title: Coalition Announced
events.notes: U.S. outlines strategy for Operation Inherent Resolve.

events.title: Airstrikes in Syria
events.notes: Coalition aircraft hit ISIS targets beyond Iraq.

events.title: Syrian Democratic Forces Form
events.notes: Kurdish and Arab militias unite as primary U.S. partner.

events.title: Battle for Mosul Begins
events.notes: Iraqi forces launch major offensive with coalition air support.

events.title: Mosul Liberated
events.notes: Iraqi government declares victory in the city.

events.title: Raqqa Falls
events.notes: SDF captures the group's Syrian capital.

events.title: Baghuz Pocket Cleared
events.notes: Remaining ISIS territory collapses in eastern Syria.
